column5: I have never really used to many of their products. For bass what products are good to use.  Thanks for any help.  Mike
I like there powerworms and tubes for bass.
yumm works better for me and way cheaper
I also love YUM baits, i would just like a little diversity in my box. Try something new.
also remember if its working dont change anything lol

I don't want to change just maybe get more stuff. Every company has their "really good" baits and this is why i am asking for powerbait right now and not Zoom, or Mizmo. Once in a while we need to try something new to further improve our fishing abilities.  Mike
oh and the 3" yellow jigging grub is ok too...
Pick up some 1/8oz jigs in yellow or orange and tip them with the pumpkinseed/chartreuese 3" power grubs. Works on everything that swims.
I like all the Berkley Baits.  4" Power Craw and 10" Power Worm get my top two votes.
i like the realstix they work well for smallies

try some of their new hollow belly swimbaits.  I have heard they work alright.  They are not too $$.  Spend a bit more and buy gulp stuff. I think it is better.  I feel as though I am working for them these days.

Power worms are excellent as are the tubes. Go for natural colours.  I love the grubs for walleye, white being an excellent choice. For some reason I catch more walleye on the power grub than on gulp.

I used a 3" tube from them last night.  Didn't catch any fish.  On the bright side, my wife thought I was hanging out with some young chick because I had glitter and sparkles all over me.  I thought I was going fishing, not getting all decked up to go to a disco.
Power worms and power tubes are proven catchers for quite some time now. I think the first pack of plastic worms I ever bought with my own money were Power Worms.
